content.text: Determine the time between the tram leaving A and arriving at C
time = .........min
Determine the maximum speed of the tram during the journey from A to E
maximum speed = .........m/s
The tram decelerates as it approaches each stop. Use information from Fig. 1.2 to identify the greatest deceleration. Give a reason for your answer
Complete the sentence
The greatest deceleration occurs as the tram approaches
reason
The total distance between A and E is \(5200 \text{m}\)
The tram takes \(1380 \text{s}\) to travel from A to E
Calculate the average speed of the tram between A and E
average speed = .........m/s
Fig. 1.1 shows a tram. Trams carry passengers from one place to another
A tram travels from A to E, stopping at B, C and D on the way
Fig. 1.2 shows the speedâ€“time graph for this tram journey
State the name of a suitable instrument for measuring the length and width of each tile
Describe how to determine the average thickness of one new tile
Calculate the volume of the tile
Calculate the density of the tile. Include the unit in your answer
density = .........unit
Calculate the weight of the tile
weight = .........N
The dimensions of a tile are \(25 \text{cm} \times 20 \text{cm} \times 0.30 \text{cm}\)
The mass of the tile is \(410 \text{g}\)
A builder buys some tiles to repair a floor. He checks that the new tiles are the same size as the tiles on the floor
The dimensions of the tiles on the floor are \(25 \text{cm} \times 20 \text{cm} \times 0.30 \text{cm}\)
The new tiles are shown in Fig. 2.1
Table 3.1 contains incomplete information about the input energy and the useful output energy for a number of devices. The table is only complete for the microphone
Complete Table 3.1 by writing in each blank space
Complete the sentences about energy transfers
1. When the player swings the tennis racket, his body converts
2. When the tennis ball is moving upwards, the ball gains .................................. energy
Explain why the height gained by the ball decreases with each successive bounce
A tennis player hits a ball over the net and it bounces as shown in Fig. 3.1
Give the state of the substance between A and B on Fig. 4.1
State the process that is occurring at:
A
B
During an experiment, a heater supplies thermal energy to a substance. Initially, the substance is a solid. The substance is heated until it becomes a gas
The temperature of the substance varies with time as shown in Fig. 4.1
The experiment is repeated using a heater with a greater power output. All other variables are kept constant
Suggest how the temperature of the substance varies with time. Draw on Fig. 4.1
Describe the arrangement and movement of the molecules in a solid and in a gas. Write your answer in Table 4.1
continue the path of the ray in the glass prism to a boundary between glass and air
draw and label the normal at the point your ray hits the boundary between glass and air
continue your ray until it emerges into the air
A student shines a ray of red light towards a large glass prism, as shown in Fig. 5.1. The angles of the prism are \(45^{\circ}\), \(90^{\circ}\) and \(45^{\circ}\)
The critical angle for the glass is \(42^{\circ}\)
On Fig. 5.1:
On Fig. 5.2, write the names of the missing colours
State the property of visible light that increases in the direction of the arrow in Fig. 5.2
The spectrum of visible light is made up of seven colours
Fig. 5.2 shows a partially completed spectrum for visible light
State the name of the distance labelled PF on Fig. 6.1
On Fig. 6.1, draw another ray that enables you to locate the image of O
Draw an arrow to indicate the image. Label the image I
Circle two words from the list which describe the image I
**enlarged** **diminished** **same size** **inverted** **upright**
A vertical arrow O is used as an object for a converging lens
Fig. 6.1 shows a ray of light from the object passing through the lens
The point labelled F is a principal focus of the lens
State the term for the reflected sound
Table 7.1 lists properties of a sound wave
Compare the properties of the original sound and the reflected sound. For each property, place a tick \((\checkmark)\) in one column
The first property is done for you
Suggest a suitable device for measuring the time interval between hearing the original sound and hearing the reflected sound
The time interval between hearing the original sound and hearing the reflected sound is 3.1s
Use information shown in Fig. 7.1 to calculate the speed of sound
speed of sound = .........m/s
Student B measures the time between the original sound and the reflected sound
Two students, A and B, determine the speed of sound
They are standing side by side at a distance of \(520 \text{m}\) from a wall, as shown in Fig. 7.1
Student A makes a loud sound by banging two blocks of wood together once. A short time later, both students hear the sound reflected from the wall
Fig. 8.1 shows several situations in which regions of the electromagnetic (EM) spectrum are being used
Table 8.1 gives **three** of these situations
State the name of the region of the EM spectrum which is being used in each situation

table.html:
situationregion of EM spectrum
1girl listening to radio
2boy using mobile phone
3security guard checking bags

content.text: All waves can be reflected, refracted and diffracted

property 1
property 2

State an advantage of using a circuit breaker instead of a fuse
Fig. 9.2 shows the circuit for a hair dryer
A different hair dryer has a fuse and two heat settings
When the hair dryer is used on the low heat setting, the current in the hair dryer is 5.2A. When the hair dryer is used on the high heat setting, the current in the hair dryer is 8.9A
Circle **one** correct fuse rating for this hair dryer
5A
State which radioactive emission:

Determine the number of neutrons in one nucleus of iodine-131. ................................
Iodine-131 is a radioactive isotope that is commonly used in medicine
The nuclide notation for a nucleus of iodine-131 is:
Radioactive iodine-131 has a half-life of 8 days
The activity of a sample of iodine-131 is 1600 counts/s
Calculate the activity of this sample after 24 days
activity = .........counts/s
